Requirements for running Zapping
V4L, V4L2 or XVideo support for your TV card
A working Gnome desktop, with the common libraries
libunicode version 0.4 or later
The remote control plugin (alirc incarnation) needs the LIRC (Linux Infrared Remote Control) package. If not already part of your distribution you can download LIRC from http://www.lirc.org.
The mpeg plugin needs the rte library, available from the Zapping dowload page. You need not download mp1e or tveng, as these are already included in the rte library and Zapping, respectively.
RPM packages The precompiled RPM packages I distribute are built in a SuSE 7.2 system with all the extra packages installed. If you want to build your own packages, you can run the script named 'prepare_dist.sh' that comes with the zapping source: tar xvIf zapping.tar.bz2 cd zapping ./prepare_dist.sh
I'm looking for volunteers to maintain packages for different distributions, if you are interested, please mail me. Everything you need to do is to type the lines above and send me the resulting package.
If some package dependency cannot be solved, a good way to install the missing packages is to fetch a Ximian GNOME desktop. If you have an RPM based distro, you can alternatively look for the packages using RPMFIND. Debian users can get the debian packages from testing and unstable, both maintained by Christian Marillat.
Compiling Zapping
If you want to compile Zapping yourself, make sure you have the appropiate development packages installed. For example, if compiling complains about AM_PATH_LIBGLADE, make sure you have libglade-devel correctly installed.
Downloading via HTTP
You can download the latest version of Zapping from the SourceForge project page, or all files released by this project from the dowload page.
Due to popular demand, the code interfacing with video capture drivers (V4L, V4L2 and XVideo) has been published as a separate package. The module called tveng is also available from the project page. The realtime MPEG-1 encoder mp1e the rte library is based on, is available as a stand-alone command line application from the same place.
Downloading via CVS
To get the latest development version of Zapping you can access the CVS server anonymously. Remember that there is no warranty that it will even compile. This method is mainly for developers and people that want to have the very latest, probably very buggy, and occasionally heavily bugfixed, version. Enter the following:
cvs -z3 -d:pserver:anonymous@cvs.zapping.sf.net:/cvsroot/zapping login You will be asked for a password, just hit return.
cvs -z3 -d:pserver:anonymous@cvs.zapping.sf.net:/cvsroot/zapping co zapping This will check out the latest version of Zapping (or "co rte" if you want), from now on you can enter in your zapping (or rte) directory:
cvs -z3 update -dP to update your local copy of the CVS repository.
You can also browse the CVS repository, or download this daily updated snapshot of the CVS tree zapping-cvsroot.tar.gz. Caution: This contains the source and all changes ever made, the file is very large.
